post.description: This method is used to verify that the connection to the backing data store works. This API is designed to be used for monitoring and debugging purposes. From the callerâ€™s perspective, this method does the following: Calls List on the backing data store, attempting to list up to one blob/object/etc. If the above succeeds, and if a blob/object/etc is found, calls Get on that object, attempting to download one byte.

parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.description: The name of the storage connector

parameters.description: The content of the action request

AccessPolicy.description: Policy that specify the permission allowed to a managed identity.

principalId.description: The AAD principal ID of the Managed Identity.

tenantId.description: The AAD tenant ID of the Managed Identity.

permission.description: Allowed permissions. Currently, only supported value is Read.

AccessPolicyPermission.description: The permissions supported in access policies

assetPath.description: Source Path to be shared. It can be a folder or a blob. The asset path should contain container name followed by path within the container, e.g. /container1/logs/external.

displayName.description: Consumer visible name of the original path.

AuthProperties.description: The auth properties for bucket connection.

type.description: The auth type for bucket connection.

AuthPropertiesUpdate.description: The auth properties for bucket connection.

type.description: The auth type for bucket connection.

AuthType.description: The auth type supported for bucket connection.

Azure.ResourceManager.CommonTypes.Tracke.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

Azure.ResourceManager.ResourceProvisioni.description: The provisioning state of a resource type.

Connection.description: Details related to the type of bucket connection

type.description: Type of the connection - Endpoint or PrivateLink. Controls the type of the connection object. Not mutable once the Storage Connector is created.

ConnectionType.description: The connection type for bucket connection

Connector.description: A Connector is a tracked ARM resource modeled as a sub-resource of a Storage Account

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

ConnectorListResult.description: The response of a Connector list operation.

value.description: The Connector items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

uniqueId.description: System-generated identifier for the Storage Connector. Not a valid input parameter when creating.

state.description: State - Active or Inactive. Whether or not the Storage Connector should start as active (default: Active) (While set to false on the Storage Connector, all data plane requests using this Storage Connector fail, and this Storage Connector is not billed if it would be otherwise.)

creationTime.description: System-generated creation time for the Storage Connector. Not a valid input parameter when creating.

description.description: Arbitrary description of this Storage Connector. Max 250 characters.

testConnection.description: Test connection to backing data source before creating the storage connector.

dataSourceType.description: The source of the backing data source.

source.description: Information about how to communicate with and authenticate to the backing data store.

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

state.description: State - Active or Inactive. Whether or not the Storage Connector should start as active (default: Active) (While set to false on the Storage Connector, all data plane requests using this Storage Connector fail, and this Storage Connector is not billed if it would be otherwise.)

description.description: Arbitrary description of this Storage Connector. Max 250 characters.

testConnection.description: Test connection to backing data source before creating the storage connector.

source.description: Information about how to communicate with and authenticate to the backing data store.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

dataShareUri.description: The URI of the backing DataShare. Must be in the format: azds://<region>:<DataShareName>:<DataShareIdentifier>

DataShareListResult.description: The response of a DataShare list operation.

value.description: The DataShare items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

dataShareIdentifier.description: System-generated identifier for the Storage DataShare. Not a valid input parameter when creating.

description.description: Arbitrary description of this Data Share. Max 250 characters.

dataShareUri.description: The DataShare URI to be shared with the consumer. URI Format - 'azds://<location>:<dataShareName>:<dataShareIdentifier>'.

accessPolicies.description: List of access policies that specify the permission allowed to a managed identity.

assets.description: List of assets that specify the properties of the shared resources.

description.description: Arbitrary description of this Data Share. Max 250 characters.

accessPolicies.description: List of access policies that specify the permission allowed to a managed identity.

assets.description: List of assets that specify the properties of the shared resources.

DataShareSource.description: The properties of the backing data store.

authProperties.description: Details for how to authenticate to the backing data store.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

DataSourceType.description: The type of the backing data source.

ManagedIdentityAuthProperties.description: The managed identity properties for dataShare connection.

identityResourceId.description: ARM ID of the managed identity that should be used to authenticate to the backing data source.

ManagedIdentityAuthPropertiesUpdate.description: The managed identity properties for dataShare connection.

identityResourceId.description: ARM ID of the managed identity that should be used to authenticate to the backing data source.

Source.description: The type of backing data source

type.description: Type of the Storage Connector - Bucket. Not mutable once the Storage Connector is created.

SourceType.description: The type of the backing data source

SourceUpdate.description: The type of backing data source

type.description: Type of the Storage Connector - Bucket. Not mutable once the Storage Connector is created.

storageConnectorMethodName.description: Indicates the method used to validate the connection to the backing data store. Valid values are `GetBlob` and `ListBlobs` for failure, and `TestExistingConnection` for success.

storageConnectorErrorMessage.description: A string representing the error received from the backing data store. Format will vary depending on the data store type and will be capped at 1 MB in size. The error message will be empty if the connection was successful.

storageConnectorRequestId.description: The request Id associated with the request sent to the backing data store for validation.

uniqueId.description: The uniqueId of the connector as returned by the server.
